instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-02100: What is 820-02100? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power issues
threads.message:
This has no liquid damage, looks pristine, and randomly died on the client. Magsafe 3 and usb-c turn on for a few seconds and then goes back off and back on. All voltages appear during these few seconds including <SIGNAL>PP1V8_S1_CLVR_VDDH</SIGNAL>.

Does this sound repairable and is there a boardview available yet?

This board is having the exact same symptoms as this post [URL]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-charging-pulsing.63686/[/URL]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power issues
threads.message: all usbc ports behave the same on my board

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power issues
threads.message:
Boadview available in pdf format only.

Did you test the board alone on the desk?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power issues
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power issues
threads.message: Same behavior in the case or alone on the desk. CPU warms up if board sits on desk long enough with magsafe or usb-c continuously blinking every few seconds.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power issues
threads.message: Anymore ideas on this one or should it be blamed on bad M1/ssd issue?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power issues
threads.message: No way to put in DFU mode?
